title: Bug 21706 - BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
description: Bug 21706 - BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
OB: The problem is that the method 'static Callback callback = new Callback (BidiUtil.class, "windowProc", 4);' in org.eclipse.swt.internal.BidiUtil class uses 'Class.forName()' which throws a NoClassDefFoundError. This error is not defined in the CLDC class libraries. This causes an issue in the CLDC version of SWT. This problem can only be observed if jxeLink or something similar is verified or used, as the compiler assumes that NoClassDefFoundError is available. As a result, there are no compiler errors from the eclipse compiler or Sun's compiler.
EB: To address this issue, it is suggested to add a private constructor to the BidiUtil class. Since there are no nonstatic methods in this class, having a private constructor would prevent unnecessary instantiation. This change would not add any additional size because the compiler automatically generates a free public constructor. It only modifies the constructor's visibility from public to private.
